Articles.Content:
Excellent stuff, thank you!

...does it handle loading in the new part after creation, or do we still need to restart the game each time? ^^;

Excellent stuff, thank you!

...does it handle loading in the new part after creation, or do we still need to restart the game each time? ^^;

Up to you. You can risk and enable the reload of the gamedatabase in the settings, but there is no guarantee that it will work flawless, especial in case of heavy modded games.

Up to you. You can risk and enable the reload of the gamedatabase in the settings, but there is no guarantee that it will work flawless, especial in case of heavy modded games.

Ahh, OK, didn't realise it was a risk might try it and see how it goes! How bad can it be...

Ahh, OK, didn't realise it was a risk might try it and see how it goes! How bad can it be...

Worst that can happen is: The database gets not reloaded completly and properly and parts are missing and the game will tell you that some crafts can no longer be maintained. But that is highly depending on the amount of mods and MM patches.
I just got back into town off of an extended Holiday and still plan to post my results using that special build. Sorry it has taken so long.
Will this 0.90 version work well with b9?
Yeah that version for .24 that you posted didn't show up in game and wasn't available to select to be visible.

Yeah that version for .24 that you posted didn't show up in game and wasn't available to select to be visible.

Most probably it conflicts with configs from newer version.

This is full pack. I tried it in 0.24.2 - it's works.

I have find 2 weldings that give problems

This example lose 1 attach point at Advanced Stabilizer

B1LFCargo.cfg

PART
{
    name = B1LFCargo
    module = Part
    author = UbioZurWeldingLtd
    rescaleFactor = 1
    PhysicsSignificance = -1
    node_stack_bottomrtg3 = 0,-0.76175,-0.25206,0,1,0,0
    node_stack_toprtg3 = 0,-0.10815,-0.25206,0,1,0,0
    node_stack_bottomtrussPiece1x2 = 0,-0.91095,0.07333,0,1,0,1
    node_attach = 0,0,0,0,0,0,0
    CrewCapacity = 0
    TechRequired = advFlightControl
    entryCost = 53600
    cost = 5405
    category = Utility
    subcategory = 0
    title = B1-LF Cargo
    manufacturer = UbioZur Welding Ltd
    description = Warranty void during re-entry.
    attachRules = 1,1,1,1,0,0,0
    mass = 0.355
    dragModelType = default
    maximum_drag = 0.1875
    minimum_drag = 0.1875
    angularDrag = 1.5
    crashTolerance = 33.40845
    breakingForce = 84.67606
    breakingTorque = 84.67606
    maxTemp = 3000
    fuelCrossFeed = True
    MODEL
    {
        model = Squad/Parts/Command/inlineAdvancedStabilizer/model
        position = 0,0.62833,0.07333
        scale = 1,1,1
        rotation = 0,0,0
    }
    MODEL
    {
        model = Squad/Parts/Electrical/z-1kBattery/model
        position = 0,0.31845,0.07333
        scale = 1,1,1
        rotation = 0,0,0
    }
    MODEL
    {
        model = Squad/Parts/Structural/trussGirderL/model
        position = 0,-0.35168,0.07333
        scale = 1,1,1
        rotation = 0,0,0
    }
    MODEL
    {
        model = Squad/Parts/Electrical/RTG/model
        position = 0,-0.43495,-0.25206
        scale = 1,1,1
        rotation = 360,180,0
    }
    RESOURCE
    {
        name = ElectricCharge
        amount = 1000
        maxAmount = 1000
    }
    MODULE
    {
        name = ModuleReactionWheel
        PitchTorque = 15
        YawTorque = 15
        RollTorque = 15
        RESOURCE
        {
            name = ElectricCharge
            rate = 0.45
        }
    }
    MODULE
    {
        name = ModuleGenerator
        isAlwaysActive = true
        OUTPUT_RESOURCE
        {
            name = ElectricCharge
            rate = 0.75
        }
    }
}

That one have problems in VAB parts-menu (don't stop to become big), the code in .cfg seems right to me

SProbeBody.cfg

PART
{
    name = SProbeBody
    module = Part
    author = UbioZurWeldingLtd
    rescaleFactor = 1
    PhysicsSignificance = -1
    node_stack_bottomtoroidalFuelTank1 = 0,-0.176,0,0,1,0,1
    node_stack_topbatteryBankMini3 = 0,0.67227,0,0,1,0,0
    node_attach = 0,0,0,0,0,0,0
    CrewCapacity = 0
    TechRequired = precisionEngineering
    entryCost = 15400
    cost = 1260
    category = Structural
    subcategory = 0
    title = S-Probe Body
    manufacturer = UbioZur Welding Ltd
    description = Warranty void during re-entry.
    attachRules = 1,0,1,1,0,0,0
    mass = 0.05999999
    dragModelType = default
    maximum_drag = 0.1875
    minimum_drag = 0.17812
    angularDrag = 1.125
    crashTolerance = 6.66667
    breakingForce = 40.66667
    breakingTorque = 40.66667
    maxTemp = 2900
    fuelCrossFeed = True
    MODEL
    {
        model = Squad/Parts/FuelTank/fuelTankOscarB/model
        position = 0,0.098,0
        scale = 1,1,1
        rotation = 0,0,0
    }
    MODEL
    {
        model = Squad/Parts/FuelTank/fuelTankToroidal/model
        position = 0,-0.12614,0
        scale = 1,1,1
        rotation = 0,0,0
    }
    MODEL
    {
        model = Squad/Parts/Electrical/z-200Battery/model
        position = 0,0.37227,0
        scale = 1,1,1
        rotation = 0,0,0
    }
    MODEL
    {
        model = Squad/Parts/Electrical/z-200Battery/model
        position = 0,0.57227,0
        scale = 1,1,1
        rotation = 0,0,0
    }
    RESOURCE
    {
        name = LiquidFuel
        amount = 15.735
        maxAmount = 15.735
    }
    RESOURCE
    {
        name = Oxidizer
        amount = 19.2
        maxAmount = 19.2
    }
    RESOURCE
    {
        name = ElectricCharge
        amount = 400
        maxAmount = 400
    }
}

Sorry for my bad english

Regards

Luca
Thank you very much with an update for this awesome mod! Downloading it now, trying it later this week. Again, thank you for the awesome work you guys put in this epic tool.

Hi, that is not a known and old problem of some partpacks but has nothing to do with welding.

There is a common fix for it.

Hi,

Thanks for updating this for 0.90!

This is my first try so I'd appreciate some advise...

I try to build a simple sky crane using only stock parts (not even tweak scale): probe core, reaction wheel, battery, clamp-o-tron, 1+3x tanks, 3x 24-77 engine, 3x 1x6 solar panel and 3x flood light.

All 3x parts are in 120 degree symmetry.

I see some strange effects:

  • 2 of 3 lights are lit and can't be turned off. 1 light, the one in position I've placed them with 3x symmetry in editor, can be turned on/off.
  • 2 of 3 solar panels are fixed and closed. Seem to be really closed.
  • One (again where I've placed in editor) is twisted in a strange way. Seems to be open, charges the battery.
  • Heat production / radiation is messed up somehow. Total heat production of the engines is 3x150, seems to be right. However it overheats and explodes quickly. Of course I can decrease the heat production by hand then it is fine.
  • Fuel consumption is very unbalanced. Liquid fuel is used much more faster than oxidizer, 3.4 / 1.4, original engines have 0.73 / 0.89 so in total it should be approx 2.2 / 2.67. 


PART
{
    name = k1
    module = Part
    author = UbioZurWeldingLtd
    rescaleFactor = 1
    PhysicsSignificance = -1
    node_stack_bottomfuelTankSmallFlat5 = -1.31469,0.03831,0,1,0,0,1
    node_stack_bottomfuelTankSmallFlat8 = 0.65735,0.03831,1.13856,-0.5,0,-0.86603,1
    node_stack_bottomfuelTankSmallFlat11 = 0.65735,0.03831,-1.13856,-0.5,0,0.86603,1
    node_stack_topprobeCoreOcto20 = 0,0.9954,0,0,1,0,0
    node_stack_topdockingPort213 = 0,-0.92405,0,0,-1,0,1
    node_attach = 0,0,0,0,0,0,0
    CrewCapacity = 0
    TechRequired = start
    entryCost = 79600
    cost = 11045
    category = Pods
    subcategory = 0
    title = My welded part
    manufacturer = UbioZur Welding Ltd
    description = Warranty void during re-entry.
    attachRules = 1,1,1,1,0,0,0
    mass = 0.8249999
    dragModelType = default
    maximum_drag = 0.20045
    minimum_drag = 0.20045
    angularDrag = 1.00223
    crashTolerance = 7.62628
    breakingForce = 81.63503
    breakingTorque = 81.63503
    maxTemp = 1200
    fuelCrossFeed = True
    MODEL
    {
        model = Squad/Parts/Command/probeCoreOcto2/model
        position = 0,0.93433,0
        scale = 1,1,1
        rotation = 0,0,0
    }
    MODEL
    {
        model = Squad/Parts/Command/inlineReactionWheel/model
        position = 0,0.78216,0
        scale = 0.5,0.5,0.5
        rotation = 0,0,0
    }
    MODEL
    {
        model = Squad/Parts/Electrical/z-1kBattery/model
        position = 0,0.58019,0
        scale = 1,1,1
        rotation = 0,0,0
    }
    MODEL
    {
        model = Squad/Parts/FuelTank/fuelTankT200/model
        position = 0,-0.08591,0
        scale = 1.25,1.25,1.25
        rotation = 0,0,0
    }
    MODEL
    {
        model = Squad/Parts/Utility/radialAttachmentPoint/model
        position = -0.64281,0.03831,0
        scale = 1,1,1
        rotation = 90,270,0
    }
    MODEL
    {
        model = Squad/Parts/FuelTank/fuelTankT100/model
        position = -1.00219,0.03831,0

        rotation = 0,0,270

    {

        scale = 1,1,1
        rotation = 0,180.0001,2E-05
    }
    RESOURCE
    {
        name = ElectricCharge
        amount = 1002

    }
    RESOURCE
    {

    {
        name = Oxidizer
        amount = 275
        maxAmount = 275
    }
    MODULE
    {

            name = ElectricCharge

        }
    }

        SASServiceLevel = 2

        }
    }
    MODULE

All 3x parts are in 120 degree symmetry.

  • 2 of 3 lights are lit and can't be turned off. 1 light, the one in position I've placed them with 3x symmetry in editor, can be turned on/off.
  • 2 of 3 solar panels are fixed and closed. Seem to be really closed.
  • One (again where I've placed in editor) is twisted in a strange way. Seems to be open, charges the battery.
  • Heat production / radiation is messed up somehow. Total heat production of the engines is 3x150, seems to be right. However it overheats and explodes quickly. Of course I can decrease the heat production by hand then it is fine.

Hi Kubi,

the problems you meantion are some leacy things that we still didn't find a workaround for.

The Basic rules are:

  • If you want to weld animated parts never use more than one.
  • If you want to weld lights never use more than one.
  • If you want to weld engines never use more than one, it still may break the part.

About the max temperature you can find the setting for how it shall be calculated, like the breaking torque/force in the settings option in the main window of the weldingtool.

Because UbioZur has kindly allowed to update his work, Girka2k and I have released the next update for this great mod.

Is there a way to fix this?

Thanks!
